page.title: 17THE CATTLE BREEDING CENTRE.
page.content: There are two other places which employ a number of workers in this area,namely,the Cattle Breeding Centre and the racehorse Training Stables. The{Cattle Breeding Centre}- known locally as "the bull palace" - is run by the{Milk Marketing Board}and was opened in 1948.The Centre consists of offices,a well equipped laboratory and 15 acres of land.It employs three stockmen, two who live in the houses next to the Centre,a Manager- Mr.Witty and 25 inseminators (24 men, 1 woman). At the present time the Centre has 28 bulls - it can take up to 36. These are divided into five{Dairy}breeds and ten{Beef}breeds. A bull can drink 10 to 20 gallons of water per day, it can eat about 50 kilos of grass per day and can weigh between 8 and 26 cwts. - the average being 16 cwts.
